```{r}
# I have already installed the necessary packages so next is to load the libraries readxl to read in the data saved on my computer, ggplot2 for plotting
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

# I tried numerious times to find a data set but ended up creating my own fictitious dataset of the abilities of enhancer counts from different sources as the outliers made the plotting irrelevant 
data <- data.frame(
  enhancer_length = rep(seq(1, 5, 0.1), 7),
  enhancer_count = c(
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 2.5, sd = 0.5) * 10^4,  # Ensembl
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 2.8, sd = 0.6) * 10^4,  # FANTOM
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 2.6, sd = 0.4) * 10^3,  # VISTA
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 3.2, sd = 0.5) * 10^3,  # ENCODE
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 2.9, sd = 0.5) * 10^3,  # All sources
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 2.5, sd = 0.6) * 10^3,  # All clusters
    dnorm(seq(1, 5, 0.1), mean = 3.0, sd = 0.5) * 10^4   # Custom data
  ),
  source = factor(rep(c("Ensembl", "FANTOM", "VISTA", "ENCODE", "All sources", "All clusters", "Custom"), each = length(seq(1, 5, 0.1))))
)

# Lets look at the plot with gpplot2 by scalling the x and y labels , giving them names and a title of my plot
ggplot(data, aes(x = enhancer_length, y = enhancer_count, color = source)) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  scale_y_log10() +  
  scale_x_log10() +  
  labs(x = "Enhancer length (bp), log10", y = "Enhancer count, log10", color = "Source") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    text = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.position = "top",
    legend.title = element_blank(),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
  ) +
  ggtitle("Enhancer Count by Length across Sources")
```
